We agree that this aid is mobilised swiftly, although this fund only represents limited support for those targeted by the consequences of the liberalisation of world trade, and further reaffirms our criticism of the lack of measures to halt the course of the neoliberal policies that have once again led to this outcome.

name: Milan ZVER
text: Writing. – I voted in favour of the report on the proposal for a decision of the European Parliament and of the Council on the use of the European Globalisation Adjustment Fund in the case of Mory-Ducros SAS, because the bankruptcy of that company and the dismissal of workers are directly linked to the global financial and economic crisis. The overall decline in physical production in Europe has led to a reduction in the amount of material to be transported by road, which is why, since 2007, in France, margins have been steadily reduced and losses have been steadily reduced in the road haulage sector, followed by a wave of bankruptcies. Mory-Ducros SAS thus laid off 2513 workers at 84 plants throughout mainland France. More than 17% of beneficiaries are aged between 55 and 64 and participation in the proposed support measures will be able to help them prevent long-term unemployment and social exclusion. The European Globalisation Adjustment Fund funds for workers affected by the consequences of major structural changes in world trade flows, the consequences of the global financial and economic crisis and their reintegration into the labour market.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. The figure of the Social Protection Committee follows the mandate of Article 160 TFEU. Consultative in nature, it contributes to the evaluation and supervision of the social protection policies of the Union and of the Member States. In practice, the figure of the Social Protection Committee is strongly related to the functions of the European Semester, with which the European institutions coordinate and impose tough reforms of social protection systems on the Member States, with the complicity of a majority of neoliberal governments. I cannot accept that the Social Protection Committee serves to legitimize the erosion of democratic sovereignty, the loss of social rights and the dismantling of social services for the benefit of private capital. For all this, I voted against it.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against this Report as the specific vote concerned the extension of the mandate of the chair of the committee from 2 to 4 years.  In the proposal for the change of the mandate, the extension is linked to the cycle of the European Semester, including also country-specific recommendations. The European Semester is a fundamentally undemocratic pact. Its focus is supposedly to avoid economic boom and bust cycles, and is aimed at restoring economic growth to the EU. However, there is no mention of equitable growth and poverty reduction. It shows a clear disconnect between European bureaucrats and the reality that is facing millions of struggling working families in Ireland and right across the EU. The European Semester reform’s primary aim seems to be just to ensure that Member States do not deviate from the economic neo-liberal ideology that it is pushing. It does not leave Member States with flexibility to implement alternative policies, which would be pro-investment, pro-growth, pro-jobs. In effect it is working to deny both Irish and other EU citizens real political choices when electing their governments and is further eroding sovereignty and reducing economic independence.

name: Nikos ANDROULAKIS
text: S&D), in writing. \u2012 This report approves the replacement of Council Decision 2006/689 in order to allow the Chairman of the Social Protection Committee to remain in office for a second term.  The European Parliament and the Employment Committee also used this report to propose two more changes to the Council's decision. The first proposal is for the Commission to examine not only the quality of the health services provided but also the degree of accessibility for all citizens. The second proposal refers to the need for better coordination of socio-economic policies.  Both of Parliament's proposals I think are particularly important and that is why I voted in favour of the report.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. This draft Council decision aims to establish the Social Protection Committee. It has an advisory role and is tasked with advising the Ministers of Employment and Social Protection on the objectives of the European semester. It consists of monitoring the social situation in the European Union and strengthening cooperation between Member States on social protection. As with the Employment Committee, the Council does not require the opinion of the European Parliament to pass this draft. In addition, the committee has a thematic and multilateral oversight role for reforms undertaken by EU countries. Countries must submit national reports, which are then reviewed by the Commission. So again, this is the establishment of yet another committee involving the affairs of the Member States of the Union. So I voted against it.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ I believe that welfare provisions should be the exclusive responsibility of the Member States. By voting against I do not comment upon the measures themselves, but on the place where these decisions should be taken.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this proposal for the establishment of a Social Protection Committee.  This committee will be an advisory body between the Council and the Commission to improve cooperation between the two institutions in the field of social security. Its tasks are to monitor the social situation and the development of social protection policies in the Member States and the EU, to promote the exchange of information and good practices between the Commission of the Member States. Also, on its own initiative, and at the request of the EC or the Council, prepare reports and formulate opinions in their field of competence. The Committee will be composed of 2 representatives from each Member State and two representatives of the Commission.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. Responsible for monitoring the social situation and the reforms undertaken, this "social protection committee" is supposed to meet one of the Union's objectives: to "modernise" social protection systems without officially undermining national competences.  Yet I see this as yet another committee of bureaucrats who interfere in the affairs of Member States by monitoring their ways of managing their social protection policies. That is why I voted against this report.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. At each beginning of the legislature, as it is not instituted by the treaties, it is necessary to re-create the Social Protection Advisory Committee, which brings together experts and national officials to assist the Council. The Committee's mission is to monitor the evolution of social protection in the Member States and to carry out reports or opinions on the issue, initiative or at the request of the Council or the Commission.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: in writing. I voted in favour because I believe that such mechanisms are necessary to advance social cohesion and a European social model which is a reference in the world. The competent authorities of the Member States should include in political and budgetary priorities the improvement and consolidation of social protection systems. I share the four priorities in which progress must be made at European level, but among them I would have liked to see included in the objective of promoting social integration, the reference to the need to move forward in a European middle income system, which Juncker has already included at our request in his Plan. It is the system that the Basque Country launched 26 years ago as "Income Guarantee Income, and which has allowed us to avoid social exclusion and achieve great social cohesion by taking us third place, after Iceland and Denmark, in sustainable human development. But above all, it is necessary for the Council to make it clear whether it will respect Parliament's position or what its changes will be if it proposes them.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. I objected to this report. The European Parliament is being asked for its opinion following the Council's decision to establish the Social Protection Committee, an advisory body for both the Council and the Commission. In 2013, the European Council said that the social dimension of economic and monetary union needed to be strengthened. The aim of this committee is to promote cooperation on social protection policies between Member States and with the Commission. It will thus have surveillance missions, exchange of information, as well as preparation of reports and opinions on social protection.  This is part of the usual hypocrisy of the European Union. While in Greece, the poverty rate at the 2009 threshold (60% of 2009 median income) jumped to 44.3%, the rate of material deprivation rose from 11% in 2009 to 20.3% in 2013, that the inability to make ends meet reached 40% in 2013 - the result of the policies imposed by the troika - the Union decides to set up a puppet committee with no real power , which will have the sole role of diverting attention from the reality of the social problems created by European economic policies.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I believe it is important to set up an Advisory Committee whose aim is to promote cooperation on social protection policies in order to achieve better and more effective coordination between the Member States and the Commission.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the proposed technical amendment to allow the chairman or chairperson of the Social Protection Committee to be eligible for a second and final term. In this way, greater stability is given to the work of this body set up to promote cooperation on social protection policies between the Member States and the Commission, with particular attention to the promotion of social integration and the guarantee of high quality and sustainable health care.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report on the Council Decision establishing the Social Protection Committee and repealing Decision 2004/689/EC. In its conclusions of 17 December 1999 on strengthening cooperation in modernising and improving social protection, the Council endorsed the Commission's proposal to establish a mechanism for enhanced cooperation set up by a high-level group of officials to implement this action.  The Council stressed that such cooperation should cover all forms of social protection and, where appropriate, assist Member States in improving and strengthening their social protection systems in line with national priorities. It also recalled the competence of the Member States to organise and finance social security and supported the following four general objectives of the Commission's global objective of modernising social protection systems: firstly, to ensure that work is paid and guaranteed. secondly, to seek guarantee pensions and the establishment of sustainable pension systems; thirdly, promoting social inclusion, and fourthly, ensuring high-quality sustainable and accessible health care for all. The Council also stressed that the principle of equality between men and women must be respected in all areas of activity in order to achieve these four objectives.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: Writing. – I was pleased to support both the draft Council decision and the minor amendment proposed to the Council by the European Parliament in the field of healthcare. It is one of the most important values in European culture, which is already historically seen in Europe as one of the most important achievements brought about by progress, namely the accessibility of all citizens to social and health care. It is precisely the accessibility to health services for the entire population that is one of the key building blocks of the welfare state. I voted in favour of the decision to set up the Social Protection Committee because in this way we can significantly contribute to a more active monitoring of the economic and social situation of the population by country and, through appropriate policies, we can also react more quickly to anomalies that occur more quickly.

name: Biljana BORZAN
text: Written. ‒I support this decision because it adapts the text of the decision to the EU's socio-economic priorities. In particular, I support text changes relating to the concept of universal healthcare.  In conclusions from June 2013 to October 2014, The European Council stated that the social dimension of the European Monetary Union needs to be strengthened. To begin with, it is important to better monitor and take into account the social and labour market situation within emu, in particular using appropriate indicators of social situation and employment within the European Semester. It is also important to ensure better coordination of employment, social and socio-economic policies with full respect for national competences.

name: Marie-Christine BOUTONNET
text: In writing. This committee, made up of technocrats, has an advisory role with the Employment, Social Policy, Health and Consumers Council, made up of ministers responsible for employment, social affairs, health and consumer protection from the Member States of the European Union. I voted against the decision to establish this committee, whose stated objective is unacceptable interference in the management of Member States' social protection policies.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this decision on the establishment of a Social Protection Committee since I consider that the current economic situation calls for more decisive actions that only a more integrated approach at the Union level can guarantee. The SPC has already proved itself useful in this respect in the past.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. While the organisation and management of social protection schemes is the exclusive responsibility of Member States, Parliament wants to better "coordinate" social protection policies by setting up a social protection committee. This umpteenth gas plant serves only to prepare the creation of a federal social protection system. Already in France and in the wake of the crisis of the RSI (social regime of the independents), legal ambiguities suggest to some independents that they can invoke European law to demand their disaffiliation of the RSI. Aware of the urgent need to preserve our ability to decide on the organisation of our social protection model, I voted against this draft Council decision.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on the decision establishing the Social Protection Committee, with the role of strengthening cooperation in the field of social protection, but also of establishing a group of high-ranking officials at EU level.  It is extremely important that better coordination in the employment and social policies sectors is ensured at European Union level, while fully respecting national competences. Monitoring the social situation and the evolution of social protection policies in the Union, facilitating the exchange of information, experience and best practices between Member States and the Commission, as well as preparing reports or drawing opinions in the areas of competence are just a few functions that the Social Protection Committee must undertake.

name: Alain CADEC
text: In writing. The European Parliament was consulted on the establishment of certain new powers for the Social Protection Committee. This committee is very important for the exchange of good practices between Member States on social protection measures. In a Union like ours, where the free movement of movement and settlement are fundamental principles, we must ensure that every citizen, wherever he comes from, is treated in the best possible way. In times of crisis, greater social coordination is needed. I voted in favour of that decision.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of this report in order to modernise and improve social protection in Europe. One in five people in the EU is at risk of social exclusion. Such a high level of people living on the margins of society undermines social cohesion and limits the potential of Europeans. This is particularly damaging at a time when Member States are working to ensure recovery from the economic and financial crisis. The Social Protection Committee, which brings together representatives of the Member States and the European Commission, can enable Member States and the European Commission to cooperate to address the challenge of social exclusion, provide a secure income, ensure the security and sustainability of pension schemes, promote social integration and ensure sustainable and high-quality health care for all. I believe that the Social Protection Committee should propose inclusion strategies combining access to the labour market and social and health services to prevent long-term exclusion and increasing the efficiency of social spending in order to facilitate participation in the labour market for all and to improve the coverage and adequacy of social safety nets.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒  I voted against this Report as the specific vote concerned the extension of the mandate of the chair of the committee from 2 to 4 years.  In the proposal for the change of the mandate, the extension is linked to the cycle of the European Semester, including also country-specific recommendations. The European Semester is a fundamentally undemocratic pact. Its focus is supposedly to avoid economic boom and bust cycles, and is aimed at restoring economic growth to the EU. However, there is no mention of equitable growth and poverty reduction. It shows a clear disconnect between European bureaucrats and the reality that is facing millions of struggling working families in Ireland and right across the EU. The European Semester reform’s primary aim seems to be just to ensure that Member States do not deviate from the economic neo-liberal ideology that it is pushing. It does not leave Member States with flexibility to implement alternative policies, which would be pro-investment, pro-growth, pro-jobs. In effect it is working to deny both Irish and other EU citizens real political choices when electing their governments and is further eroding sovereignty and reducing economic independence.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I have followed and participated actively throughout the debate on this matter. I believe that this committee has been very effective and served its advisory role very well.  I have voted in favour of this Report as I particularly agree with the fact that the Committee will give special attention to the social dimension of the European Monetary Union.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 The vote concerned the Council's decision to set up the Social Protection Committee, to which minor improvements were made. We believe that the protection of the weakest must be a priority for Europe. I therefore voted in favour of setting up such a committee.

name: Aymeric CHAUPRADE
text: In writing. I voted against this report, which endorses the Council's decision to create another European institution which will not only be costly but will also suffer from a total democratic deficit. Indeed, the role of this committee will be purely advisory; assembly of senior officials, it will be a matter of adding another technocratic layer to the European mille-feuilles. Finally, wishing that social protection would remain a prerogative of the Member States, which alone can ensure a system tailored to the needs of its citizens, I could only formally oppose this report.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Parliament approved the Council's draft as amended. The Council noted that strengthening cooperation to modernise and improve social protection should cover all forms of protection and that Member States should be helped to improve and strengthen their social protection systems according to their priorities.  In this context, Member States must achieve four main objectives identified by the Commission: (1) to make work profitable through a secure income; (2) ensuring the safety and sustainability of pension schemes; (3) promoting social integration and (4) ensuring social assistance for all. In addition, equality between men and women must be a common denominator of all these objectives.  It is also important, within the social dimension of EMU, to ensure better coordination of employment and socio-economic policies while fully respecting national competences.  For these reasons, I have chosen to vote in favour.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the introduction of a Social Protection Committee because I believe that such a sensitive and multifaceted issue should be entrusted to officials with specific expertise. Let me be quite clear: I will ensure that this new body is neither a duplication of what already exists, nor a bandwagon, nor a waste of public money, but rather a way of making the efforts made by the European institutions in this area efficient. In this way, we can pursue ambitious objectives, such as developing and modernising the social protection systems of all European countries and strengthening cooperation between them, through the exchange of experience and good practice.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the decision establishing the Social Protection Committee because, as was already pointed out in the conclusions of the Lisbon European Council in March 2000, social protection is a key element in improving the quality of life of citizens and in achieving the full realisation of an effective and dynamic welfare state in Europe. For this to happen, the strengthening of cooperation between the Member States, and therefore the exchange of information and good practice between them, is of prime importance and the establishment of a reinforced cooperation mechanism, such as the Social Protection Committee, designed precisely with this in mind. Thanks to its particular composition, which brings together two representatives from each Member State and for the Commission, the Committee will ensure greater awareness of the social policies of European countries, better sharing of the practices implemented and the results achieved. At the same time, it will help and support the Council and the Commission, to which it will provide specialised and timely advice on the social situation in the European Union.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report which approves the draft Council decision establishing the Social Protection Committee to monitor social conditions in the EU and the development of social protection policies in Member States and to promote discussion and coordination of policy approaches among national governments and the Commission.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. The figure of the Social Protection Committee follows the mandate of Article 160 TFEU. On an advisory basis, it contributes to the evaluation and supervision of the social protection policies of the Union and the Member States. In practice, the figure of the Social Protection Committee is strongly related to the functions of the European Semester, with which the European institutions coordinate and impose tough reforms of social protection systems on Member States, with the complicity of a majority of neoliberal governments. I cannot accept that the Social Protection Committee serves to legitimize the erosion of democratic sovereignty, the loss of social rights and the dismantling of social services for the benefit of private capital. For all this, I voted against it.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. – I agree with the Council decision to establish the Employment Committee. I believe this will help Member States and the European Union to develop a coordinated strategy for employment and particularly for promoting a skilled and trained workforce and a labour market which is responsive to economic change.

name: Viorica DĂNCILĂ
text: in writing. \u2012 I consider it important to ensure better coordination of policies in the areas of employment, social and socio-economic, while fully respecting national competences, and I believe that the principle of equality between women and men must be integrated into all actions aimed at achieving these objectives.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. The organisation and financing of social protection is the responsibility of the Member States. However, the modernisation of social protection systems is a major issue, and it is good to encourage convergence of approaches between the ministers of employment and social affairs on the one hand and the European Commission on the other. The Social Protection Committee has demonstrated its effectiveness in the Open Coordination Method (MOC); This effort must be pursued in line with the four objectives set out by the Commission: to make work financially attractive and guarantee income, to ensure pension security and the sustainability of pension schemes, to promote social integration, and to ensure a high and sustainable level of health protection for all.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. I voted against the report on the Council's decision establishing the Social Protection Committee. Like the Employment Committee, the Social Protection Committee aims to promote the integration and standardisation of public policies in Europe. However, I oppose, as I have always done, the erosion of national sovereignty and reaffirm the importance of an independent state. Moreover, the abundance of advisory committees shows that the European Union persists and signs in its technocratic construction, from which the citizens of the Member States are excluded.

name: Angel DZHAMBAZKI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of my colleague Ulvaskog's report approving the Council's draft establishing a Social Protection Committee.  The establishment of this Committee is clearly stated in Article 160 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union. The aim of the Committee, as enshrined in the Treaty, is to promote cooperation in the field of social protection policy between EU Member States and between them and the Commission. It also monitors the social situation in the EU and the development of social protection policies in the Member States. The Social Protection Committee also prepares reports on social inclusion, health, long-term care and pensions. I believe that setting up this committee is essential, in particular for poorer EU Member States that need guidance and support to tackle the social crisis they are in.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report and support the recommendation of the Social Protection Committee because it aims to ensure cost-effective work and a secure income, to ensure safe pensions and sustainable pension systems, to promote social inclusion and to ensure sustainable high quality healthcare for all

name: José Inácio FARIA
text: in writing. \u2012 This is a special legislative procedure for consultation, in which Parliament endorses the wording drawn up by the Council and amended by Parliament concerning the establishment of the Social Protection Committee, and the Council must inform Parliament if it depart from the wording it has previously drawn up and approved by Parliament.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. The proposed amendments do not deserve any objection to me because they reinforce the Community sense of Europe and the attention it must pay to all citizens regardless of their condition. In the cases under this case, ensuring a high and sustainable level of health care for all and better coordination of social, socio-economic and employment policies are aspects that deserve my agreement.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. \u2012 This committee, known as 'Social Protection', is set up on an advisory basis, with the express objective of 'promoting cooperation between the Member States and with the Commission in matters of social protection policies, in full respect of the Treaty and taking due account of the competence of the institutions and bodies of the Union'. 'With full respect for the Treaty' means nothing but the subjugation of social rights and protection to 'free competition in the single market', as evidenced by the case-law of the Court of Justice of the EU. In other words, the secondary of social progress vis-à-vis the 'market economy'. This Committee is set up to strengthen the social dimension of EMU in order to contribute to all aspects of the European Semester. That is, to legitimise all the economic policies that the European Commission has imposed on countries with more spending cuts, in the social functions of the state, privatising public resources, promoting redundancies and making labour costs cheaper. These measures are totally contradictory to the social objectives expressed. We don't get in the decoy. We voted against it.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing \ u2012 Articles 150 and 160 of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union provide that the European Parliament must be involved in any changes to the Social Protection Committee in question. Rather, this is a technical consultation, which relates in particular to the possible extension of the term of office of the Chairman of the Committee, since the term of office of the Chairperson can currently be extended once for a period of two years. Since this step, stakeholders have promised greater continuity in the work of the Social Protection Committee. Two other changes are also proposed to the Council, which should, above all, contribute to the Social Protection Committee focusing not only on sustainable health care, but also on its accessibility to all social sections of the population, and, secondly, better coordination of socio-economic policies is also needed.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am voting in favour of the decision establishing the Social Protection Committee to promote cooperation on social protection policies between the Member States and the Commission. The Committee shall consist of two representatives appointed by each Member State and two representatives of the Commission.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 I am in favour of setting up the Social Protection Committee because it aims to ensure cost-effective work and secure income, ensure safe pensions and sustainable pension systems, promote social inclusion and ensure sustainable high quality healthcare for all

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ In its Conclusions of 17 December 1999 on the strengthening of cooperation for modernising and improving social protection, the Council supported the Commission’s proposal to establish a mechanism for enhanced cooperation, brought about by the work of the group of high-level officials, for the implementation of this action. The Social Protection Committee set up by the Council Decision clearly demonstrated its utility as an advisory body for both the Council and the Commission and has contributed actively to the development of the Open Method of Coordination, as established by the Lisbon European Council on 23 and 24 March 2000. Considering its proven utility, I support the decision establishing the Social Protection Committee as amended by the European Parliament.

name: Ildikó GÁLL-PELCZ
text: Writing. \u2012 In its conclusions on strengthening cooperation in order to modernise and develop social protection, the Council supported the Commission's proposal to establish a mechanism for the implementation of this measure for enhanced cooperation based on the work of the High Level Group of Officials. The Council underlined that this cooperation should cover all forms of social protection and, if necessary, help Member States to further develop and strengthen their social protection systems in line with their national priorities. Of course, it remains the responsibility of the Member States to organise and finance social protection, and there is no change in that. I voted in favour of this decision because it is very important that all objectives are subject to uniform funding criteria.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the Legislative Resolution on the draft Council Decision laying down the Employment Committee and repealing Decision 2000/98/EC as it is a step forward in the aspect of the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union which provides that the Union must take the necessary measures to ensure the coordination of Member States' employment policies, to strengthen its effectiveness by developing a coordinated strategy for employment, and in particular to promote trained, trained and adaptable citizenship to changing productive needs, as well as to ensure the adaptability of labour markets to economic changes.

name: Elisabetta GARDINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report on the draft decision establishing the Social Protection Committee in order to ensure greater coordination and better promotion of social protection measures. It is a text that will enable us to maintain the very high level of social security that characterises European countries and to continue to guarantee European citizens decent living conditions.

name: Elena GENTILE
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the Council decision establishing a Social Protection Committee and repealing the previous Decision 2004/689/EC, because the aim is to promote the strengthening of the social dimension of economic and monetary union. In particular, strengthening the role of the Social Protection Committee in the European Semester and improving its efficiency, and by strengthening it, ensuring greater and better coordination of employment and social policies in the context of the European Semester, while fully respecting national competences, as stated in the Conclusions of the June 2013 European Council, improving the coordination of economic, social and labour policies, as stated in the Conclusions of the European Council of October 2013.  I also believe that it is particularly important to better monitor and take into account the social and labour market situation within EMU, specifically by using the appropriate social and employment indicators within the framework of the European Semester.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the decision to establish the Social Protection Committee given the clear need for better coordination of social protection strategies in the current economic context.

name: Michela GIUFFRIDA
text: in writing. \u2012 Although the 28 Member States all have different social security systems, it is important that the EU implements policies to ensure high levels of social protection for all citizens. While respecting the resources and peculiarities of national legislation, it is right to ask the Member States to ensure sustainable pension systems, effective social integration, universal health insurance. I therefore voted in favour of setting up the Social Protection Committee because it is a fundamental first step towards effective cooperation at European level to guarantee the social rights of our citizens.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. We voted against this Proposal by the Council to extend the Presidency of the Social Protection Committee from 2 to 4 years. The fundamental function of this Committee is to adapt the Proposals of the European Semester to employment policies in Member States. We are already against the European Semester for proposing measures such as promoting worker mobility as a way to combat unemployment, raising the retirement age, continuing to delve into structural reforms or adapting wages to productivity.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this proposal to establish the Social Protection Committee. Social protection of EU citizens must be our major priority and this committee will help with the coordination of measures between Member States.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report to establish the Social Protection Committee to advise and promote cooperation on social protection policies between Member States and with the Commission. It has demonstrated its utility as an advisory body for both the Council and Commission in the past and will continue to do so by monitoring the social situation and development of social protection policies in Member States and by promoting exchanges of information and good practice between Member States and with the Commission. In particular I support the notion that the social dimension of the EMU should be strengthened by ensuring better coordination of employment and social polices and the use of social and employment indicators.

name: Ian HUDGHTON
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report and believe that the Social Protection Committee can help to enhance the work of Employment and Social Affairs Ministers in the European Union.  I believe that Scotland would benefit from full representation at the Employment and Social Affairs Council, with a top seat at the European table as would be the case when full powers are returned to the people of Scotland.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. We voted against this Proposal by the Council to extend the Presidency of the Social Protection Committee from 2 to 4 years. One of the functions of this Committee is to adapt the proposals of the European Semester to employment policies in the Member States. We are already against the European Semester for proposing measures such as promoting worker mobility as a way to combat unemployment, raising the retirement age, continuing to delve into structural reforms or adapting wages to productivity.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the European Parliament's draft legislative resolution on the Council's draft decision establishing the Social Security and Repeal Committee decision 2004/689/EC on the basis that it strengthens, modernises and improves cooperation in the field of social security.  In my view, this way can contribute to improving social and employment policies, of utmost importance and sensitivity for the European Union, while respecting certain national competences. I support that this way enables the Committee, which has an advisory role, to monitor the social situation and development of social security policies, to exchange good practices and information and to prepare reports and opinions in the area concerned. I also strongly support the need for the Committee to work closely with the social partners.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. I have decided to vote against this Council decision. Indeed, it creates a social protection committee whose stated objective is to reform social protection systems in the Union. Outside, social protection is the exclusive competence of the Member States, since it is the result of a particular elaboration linked first of all to a history but also to a specific economic and social context, that of a nation. This committee is therefore yet another attempt by the Eurocrats to interfere and thus weaken the sovereignty of the Member States, in defiance of the peoples and nations of Europe.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. The European Parliament was consulted on the decision to establish the Social Protection Committee, which gave rise to this report. I welcome Parliament's approval of this decision. I believe that it is important to strengthen cooperation in the area of social protection and to facilitate exchanges of good practice between Member States and with the Commission.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report to create an advisory social protection committee. The main function of this committee will be to monitor the evolution of national social protection policies and to encourage the sharing of experiences and best practices between Member States and with the European Commission.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I welcome the decision to establish a Social Protection Committee to promote cooperation on social protection policies between Member States and with the Commission.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: In writing. I voted against it because this advisory committee is responsible for monitoring the modernisation of social protection systems in the Member States. It is not very dangerous at first sight, but the aim seems to be to give social support to the ultra-liberal policy of the European Union, which I do not want to do.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: In writing. Negative vote. We are still opposed to the European Union's desire to bring the Member States under control. Attached to the sovereignty of states, we believe that each of them must be able, alone and independently, to carry out the policy that he considers best. However, in this report, the European Commission envisages the establishment of an additional committee which will have the task of interfering in the affairs of the Member States with the aim of monitoring their policies. This is unacceptable for sovereignists.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. The figure of the Social Protection Committee follows the mandate of Article 160 TFEU. On an advisory basis, it contributes to the evaluation and supervision of the social protection policies of the Union and the Member States. In practice, the figure of the Social Protection Committee is strongly related to the functions of the European Semester, with which the European institutions coordinate and impose tough reforms of social protection systems on the Member States, with the complicity of a majority of neoliberal governments. I cannot accept that the Social Protection Committee serves to legitimize the erosion of democratic sovereignty, the loss of social rights and the dismantling of social services for the benefit of private capital. For all this, I voted against it.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. The Social Protection Committee, established by Council Decision 2000/436/EC ̶ repealed and replaced by Decision 2004/689/EC ̶ has clearly demonstrated its usefulness as an advisory body for both the Council and the Commission. The current proposal for a Council Decision aims to establish an advisory Social Protection Committee to promote cooperation on social protection between Member States and the EC. The tasks of the Committee shall be to monitor the social situation and the development of the social protection policies of the Member States and of the Union; promote the exchange of information and good practices between Member States and the Commission and to draw up reports, opinions or activities in their areas of competence, at the request of the Council or the Commission or on its own initiative. In addition, the Committee will cooperate with the social partners and inform the EP. The Committee shall consist of two representatives appointed by each Member State and two representatives of the Commission. The Committee shall elect its Chairman from among the members appointed by the Member States for a period of two years, renewable once. That's why I voted favorably.

name: Petr MACH
text: in writing. \u2012 I do not agree with the establishment of any commissions that would talk states into what kind of social or other policies they should create. These decisions are a matter for each individual state and its constituents.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 At a time when the European Union is filled with armies of unemployed people due to mercelian austerity and the welfare state in Europe has been dissolved, the establishment of the Social Protection Committee to be adopted, although of an advisory nature only, is a positive first step since this committee will deal with deepening cooperation between Member States and cooperate with the Commission on social protection policies. In addition, the committee to be voted on should, inter alia, monitor the social situation and the development of social protection policies in the Member States and in the Union and facilitate the exchange of information, experience and good practice between Member States and the European Commission. It should also be noted that the creation of this committee will ensure better coordination of social policy with full respect for national competences.   Finally, the Social Protection Committee will be able to commission the study of specific issues or set up working groups within its scope and thus ways of strengthening the social dimension of EMU can be explored. For these reasons, I voted in favour of the report on the draft Council decision establishing the Social Protection Committee and repealing Decision 2004/689/EC.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I voted against this decision. Indeed, the aim of this committee is to interfere in the affairs of the Member States by monitoring their management of their social protection policies and systems and reporting them to the European Commission. It is an infringement of the right of Member States to legislate and act.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ As an explanation of my vote, I felt that this was a well-balanced report on this issue.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 I welcome the draft Council decision establishing a Social Protection Committee and repealing Decision 2004/689/EC. It is necessary to set up a committee to strengthen, improve and promote social integration and to ensure high-quality health care.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. I support the European Parliament's report on the establishment of the Social Protection Committee. We must be able to establish the best possible mechanisms for enhanced social protection cooperation between Member States in order to consolidate national systems and ensure that European citizenship has adequate levels of social protection.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. I voted negatively on the decision to set up a social protection committee, as I believe that the EU's extension of competences in the areas of employment, social affairs and socio-economics must be strongly rejected.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. The Council's proposed decision is to establish an advisory social protection committee. This committee aims to promote cooperation on social protection policies between Member States and with the Commission, within the framework of the European semester. It is therefore a question of subjecting social protection even more to the objectives of austerity. This committee is invited to cooperate with the social partners and to keep Parliament informed of its work but, of course, without any obligation on its part. The report validates the proposal by amending it at the margin.  I'm voting AGAINST.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. Considering that this is a committee: - additional advisory, - composed of members chosen by co-optation, - with uncertain efficiency but costly functioning, - whose objective seems to be to interfere in the prerogatives of the States, I voted AGAINST.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 The establishment of the Social Protection Committee is very relevant to strengthening the social dimension of EMU. Better monitoring and taking more account of the social and labour market situation within EMU should be better followed up, in particular through the use of appropriate social and employment indicators within the European Semester. It is also important to ensure better coordination of social, socio-economic and employment policies, while fully respecting national competences.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in support of the proposal to establish the Social Protection Committee as social protection of the European Union’s citizens is one of our major priorities, especially in times of financial crisis. The creation of this committee will facilitate the sharing of best practices through a direct link between the competent authorities in the EU Member States.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. I agree with the adoption of the text establishing the Social Protection Committee. This new body will enable, on the one hand, a thorough monitoring of the social situation in the European Union as well as developments in the various social protection policies of the Member States and, on the other hand, better coordination of political approaches between The Member States and the European Commission in the preparation of the European Council's work on employment and social policy. Beyond that, I believe that it would be appropriate for the Economic and Monetary Union to have a social pillar.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report, which calls for support regarding the changes in Council Decision 2004/689/EC of 4 October 2004 establishing a Social Protection Committee. Articles 150 and 160 TFEU provide that the Parliament shall be consulted when establishing this Committee. The consultation is of a technical nature and concerns in particular the possible extension of the Chair’s term of office. The draft Council decision provides that the Chairperson shall be elected for a term of two years, which shall be renewable once.

name: Giulia MOI
text: in writing. \u2012 We are in favour of a stronger focus on social protection policies, but we do not think that the establishment of an additional advisory body, with related expenditure, is the right solution.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The purpose of the Council's draft decision is to set up an advisory Social Protection Committee to facilitate the coordination of social protection policies between the Member States and the Commission. I consider the Council's initiative to be justified in the light of the social tensions caused by the economic crisis and the Union's social objectives.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 The sustainability of Social Protection systems, coupled with demographic change, obliges Member States to present long-term and long-term strategies identifying problems and possible solutions. Although this issue is in the exclusive sphere of the Member States, the European Commission has presented a mechanism for further cooperation and strengthening on the themes of modernisation and improvement of social protection. Already approved by the Council, this High Level Committee aims to help Member States strengthen their social systems, always taking into account the priorities of each State.   Because of its importance to maintaining the European Social State, where gender equality is one of the principles to be taken into account, I am in favour of the creation of the Social Protection Committee.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. The European Parliament is being asked for its opinion following the Council's decision to establish the Social Protection Committee, an advisory body for both the Council and the Commission. In 2013, the European Council said that the social dimension of economic and monetary union needed to be strengthened. The aim of this committee is to promote cooperation on social protection policies between Member States and with the Commission. It will thus have surveillance missions, exchange of information, preparation of reports and opinions on social protection.  This is part of the usual hypocrisy of the European Union. While in Greece, the poverty rate at the 2009 threshold (60% of the median income in 2009) jumped to 44.3%, the rate of material deprivation rose from 11% in 2009 to 20.3% in 2013, that the inability to make ends meet reached 40% in 2013 - as a result of the policies imposed by the Troika - the EU decides to set up a puppet committee with no real power , which will have the sole role of diverting attention from the reality of the social problems created by European economic policies.  So I voted against it.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text, which modernizes the governance of the social protection committee. The role of this committee is to promote cooperation in social protection policies between Member States, with the Commission and in conjunction with social partners, in accordance with the competences of member states (funding for social protection is the responsibility of States).

name: Alessia Maria MOSCA
text: in writing. \u2012 We welcome the draft Council decision on the establishment of the Social Protection Committee in order to strengthen cooperation in the field of social protection through the creation of a high-level group of officials. In its conclusions of June 2013, the European Council stated the need to strengthen the social dimension of economic and monetary union as well. We therefore consider the role that this Advisory Committee can play in promoting enhanced cooperation in the field of social policies between the Member States and the Commission, through a system of exchange of information and good practice, to be fundamental. One of its tasks will be to contribute to the coordination of economic policies within the Framework of the European Semester and to ensure structured cooperation with all the social partners and with the other competent bodies and committees dealing with social and economic policy issues. To this end, we call for social protection systems to be made accessible to all European citizens.

name: Alessandra MUSSOLINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the draft Council decision establishing the Social Protection Committee and repealing Decision 2004/689/EC. The Committee will consist of two representatives appointed by each Member State and two representatives of the European Commission. This mechanism will help Member States to improve and strengthen their social protection systems according to their national priorities. It also affirms the competence of the Member States for the organisation and financing of social protection and endorses the four general objectives identified by the Commission in this area, namely: to make work profitable by offering a secure income, to ensure the security and sustainability of pension systems, to promote social integration and to guarantee sustainable and high-quality health care for all. It also stresses that equality between women and men must be a dominant factor in all activities aimed at achieving the four objectives mentioned above.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted for the report on the draft Council decision establishing the Social Protection Committee and repealing Decision 2004/689/EC. Such a committee allows the European Union to assess the social protection measures that are and can be implemented at Member State and EU level. A true social Europe means more social protection.

name: Momchil NEKOV
text: in writing. \u2012 I support the establishment of the Social Protection Committee because I strongly believe that seeking a common approach, and in particular common rules guaranteeing social protection, are of the utmost importance to all EU citizens. A few days ago, two women died as a result of an accident in my country of Bulgaria. The conditions in which these workers were transported from a peripheral region show that the worker's right to decent work and pay is being overrun.  In the name of social justice and the protection of our citizens, I believe that pan-European mechanisms should be sought to ensure the protection of these rights. Labour exploitation and social blackmail must stop being tolerated in every EU Member State.  I very much hope that with its establishment, the Social Protection Committee will be able to make clear and effective recommendations to the EC for guaranteed protection for each of our citizens, regardless of the Member State, region or economic employment sector.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. The European Union wants to expand its competences in the fields of employment, social affairs and social economy. For me, this decision is not justifiable; that is why I voted against this decision.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: Writing. \u2012 I agree with the decision submitted. The Social Protection Committee, which has advisory status, is an important entity to ensure better coordination of employment and social policies.  In view of developments in the context of the European Semester, it is essential that its role be strengthened accordingly and its effectiveness in the European Semester process is improved.  It should be noted that effective monitoring of the social and labour market situation and timely response to potential risks is essential, while ensuring better coordination of employment, social and economic policies, while fully respecting national competences.

name: Kostas PAPADAKIS
text: Writing. – The JRC voted against the new regulations establishing and operating an 'Employment Committee' and a 'Social Protection Committee' within the Council of the EU, committees composed of 'Member States' experts, because we believe that their sole purpose is to bring existing committees into line with the mechanisms of the European Semester and enhanced EU economic governance, i.e. the supervision and enforcement of those unpopular reforms and measures co-decided by the EU and civil governments in all Member States of the EU. The role reserved for old and new, in any case disreputable to workers, committees, is an additional attempt to manipulate the labour and popular masses by promoting the 'dialogue of the social partners', i.e. class cooperation and the subjugation of the working people to the aspirations of business groups, the 'sprinkling' of the anti-labour attack with propaganda smears of so-called 'social sensitivity', such as those to which the SYRIZA-ANEL co-government in our country is particularly zealous. The unpopular policy agreed jointly by the EU institutions and the governments of urban management in all its Member States is not 'made up', no matter how many committees and propaganda mechanisms they set up. A strong popular alliance is needed for radical changes in power and the economy for the benefit of the people.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. In view of the fact that the European Parliament approves the Council's draft as amended, invites the Council to inform it if it intends to depart from the text approved by Parliament, it asks the Council to consult it again if it intends to substantially amend the text approved by Parliament and instructs its President to forward Parliament's position to the Council and the Commission and to the national parliaments, for these reasons I voted in favour.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒ I supported the Report on the Draft Council Decision establishing the Social Security Committee, as the Social Security Committee, established on the basis of Council Decision 2000/436/EC amended by Decision 2004/689/EC, has so far proved useful to the Council and European Commission advisory body and has actively contributed to the development of open cooperation methods. Now the Social Security Committee is gaining a new dimension in the coordination of economic, employment and social protection policies between Member States, as it will monitor the social situation and the development of social protection policies and promote the exchange of experience, information and good practice between Member States. In cooperation with social partners and other relevant bodies and committees active in the field of social and economic policies and with the use of agreed monitoring and coordination methods, the implementation of prearranged objectives can be achieved. Member equality has been achieved through the very establishment of the Committee, as each Member State and the Commission will appoint two members of the Committee.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. The European Union decides to extend its grip on Member States' social protection policies. This interference and this new attack on the sovereignty of nations is obviously unacceptable. Each people must be able to democratically decide for itself what it wants as social protection. I must vote against it without hesitation.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ I support colleague Ulski's report and the Council's draft decision establishing the Social Security and Repeal Committee decision 2004/689/EC. The organisation and financing of social security is the competence of the Member States, and the four main general objectives identified by the European Commission in the context of the general challenge of modernising social security systems should be: making work cost-effective and income safe, achieving pension security and the sustainability of pension systems, promoting social inclusion, ensuring high quality and sustainability of health care for all.  I agree with the view that all activities aimed at achieving these four objectives need to be agreed on equality between women and men.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I supported Mep Maria Ulvski's report on the Draft Council Decision establishing the Social Security and Repeal Committee Decision 2004/689/EC, as I believe it is necessary to strengthen the social dimension of the Economic and Monetary Union, in particular through better coordination and monitoring of employment and social dialogue policies. Since the beginning of the European project, economic integration, and its important social dimension, have had a positive impact on growth, employment and on the living standards of citizens. In today's context, this Decision underlines the importance of monitoring the social and labour market situation more effectively, taking into account relevant social and employment indicators within the European Semester. The European Semester of Economic Policy Coordination is a common process between the EU institutions and member states where the European Parliament plays an important role. I believe that this decision gives a new impetus to social dialogue at EU and national levels, ensures better coordination of social policy and improves the effectiveness of social protection systems in full respect of national competences. Given that the internal market has contributed to Europe's social progress over the last decades, I believe that the establishment of the Social Security Committee contributes to achieving the social objectives set by the European Union.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. As we have seen, the Social Protection Committee has proved useful as an advisory body of the Council and the European Commission in the context of cooperation in the field of social protection with its group of high-level officials composed of representatives of the Member States and the Commission.  That is why I support its creation with a very specific mission and functions, hence the repeal of Decision 2004/689/EC, which will be replaced by the current one.

name: Jiří POSPÍŠIL
text: in writing. \u2012 I supported the report because I consider social protection to be an important part of politics. In the case of the committee concerned by this proposal, I also appreciate that it is an advisory body that connects the representatives of individual Member States, as this area is still heavily influenced by the legislative decisions of the Member States.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. At a time when the health of European citizens is at the heart of the Union's economic and social policies, Parliament yesterday adopted the council's proposed amendments to the decision establishing the Social Protection Committee. Two points were added: ensuring health protection for all, and better taking into account socio-economic policies and their impact on other areas. I voted in favour of the changes to that decision.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. The conclusions of the Lisbon European Council of 23 and 24 March 2000 pointed to the importance of modernising and improving the social protection system in the EU and called for enhanced cooperation between Member States to exchange experiences and best practices. As part of the global challenge of modernising social protection systems, the Commission identified four main objectives: to make work pay and to ensure a safe income; ensuring pension security and the sustainability of pension systems; promoting social inclusion; and ensure a high and sustainable level of health care. The Council supported the Commission's proposal to establish a mechanism for closer cooperation, achieved through the work of a group of high-level officials, for the implementation of this action. This Committee shall take into account the social situation and the development of social protection policies in the Member States and the Union, prepare reports and make opinions in its fields of competence, at the request of the Council or the Commission or on its own initiative. This Decision establishes the Social Protection Committee. I voted in favour.

name: Frédérique RIES
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the Ulvskog report, which approves the draft decision of the Council establishing the Social Protection Committee.  The establishment of this body follows the conclusions of the European Council in June 2013 calling for strengthening the social dimension of economic and monetary union. First, it is important to better monitor and take better account of the situation within EMU, both in the social field and in the labour market, including through the use of appropriate social and employment indicators within the framework of the European Semester. Better coordination of social, socio-economic and employment policies is needed, as requested by the European Parliament's Amendment 1. Of course, social Europe takes time to set up and deliver the desired results for European citizens, young and old, who want to enter the labour market or simply to find it, but the will is there for the social to be taken into account in the main European policies, despite competences limited by the treaties.

name: Liliana RODRIGUES
text: in writing. The financial crisis has had terrible effects on the quality of life of a very significant part of the European population. Poverty rates are alarming. It is the European Union's obligation to make every effort to help Member States improve and strengthen their social protection systems in the light of their national priorities. We can't fail when people need it most. We need to redefine priorities and ensure the sustainability of pension systems by promoting social inclusion and health care.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the proposed technical amendment to allow the chairman or chairperson of the Social Protection Committee to be eligible for a second and final term. In this way, greater stability is given to the work of this body set up to promote cooperation on social protection policies between the Member States and the Commission, with particular attention to the promotion of social integration and the guarantee of high quality and sustainable health care.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the Council's proposal to create an advisory social protection committee. This committee should promote cooperation on social protection policies between Member States and with the Commission. Europe does have to answer the question of its social convergence, and I think this committee can contribute to that. Its missions are numerous and range from monitoring the social situation to facilitating the exchange of information, to preparing reports or forming opinions at the request of the Council or the Commission, but also on its own initiative. I have chosen to vote in favour of this Council's decision to set up such a committee because I am convinced that it will strengthen social protection in Europe.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 By voting, I supported the Council's decision to renew and supplement the mandate of the Social Protection Committee with new functions. This committee is active in a key area - making recommendations on social protection, health, pensions and social inclusion - in areas that are largely not governed by EU law. In the case of the possibility of binding decisions by Member States, the search for compromise, the exchange of good practices and the identification of elements of good European practice through compromise are essential. I therefore believe that the renewed and revised mandate of the Committee will contribute both to more effective coordination of the social policies of the Member States and to the further development and development of the informal European governance instrument - the open model of coordination .

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. \u2012 Social protection is an area that deserves all our concern and the European Union is a global paradigm in social protection systems. To that end, I welcome the proposal to set up a Social Protection Committee, which is in line with those already drawn up by the conclusions of the Lisbon European Council of 23 and 24 March 2000. With this mechanism, greater cooperation between Member States will be possible to improve and improve their social protection systems. I also agree with the four objectives identified by the Commission in the field of modernising social protection systems, the competence of which also belongs to the Member States. This Committee will thus monitor the social situation and developments in social protection policies in the Member States and also in the European Union, facilitating the exchange of information, the sharing of experience and the development of good practice in this area.

name: Massimiliano SALINI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of repealing Decision 200/689/EC because I believe that the Social Protection Committee has actively contributed to the development of open coordination between the European institutions and the Member States. However, as required by the approved text, it needed to be amended in order to make this committee more up-to-date and in step with current times and needs.

name: Matteo SALVINI
text: in writing. I have chosen to vote in favour of setting up an advisory committee to promote cooperation on social protection policies between the Member States and the Commission. It consists of two appointed representatives from each Member State and two representatives of the Commission. Its functions are to monitor the social situation and the development of social protection policies in the Member States and the Union and to promote exchanges of information, experience and good practice between the Member States and with the Commission.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. We voted against this Proposal by the Council to extend the chairmanship of the Social Protection Committee from two to four years. One of the functions of this Committee is to adapt the proposals of the European Semester to employment policies in the Member States. We are already against the European Semester for proposing measures such as promoting worker mobility as a way to combat unemployment, raising the retirement age, continuing to delve into structural reforms or adapting wages according to productivity.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. The figure of the Social Protection Committee follows the mandate of Article 160 TFEU. On an advisory basis, it contributes to the evaluation and supervision of the social protection policies of the Union and the Member States. In practice, the figure of the Social Protection Committee is strongly related to the functions of the European Semester, with which the European institutions coordinate and impose tough reforms of social protection systems on the Member States, with the complicity of a majority of neoliberal governments. I cannot accept that the Social Protection Committee serves to legitimize the erosion of democratic sovereignty, the loss of social rights and the dismantling of social services for the benefit of private capital. For all this, I voted against it.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the Council's decision to strengthen the role of the Social Protection Committee on an advisory basis so that cooperation between the Member States and with the Institutions of the European Union with regard to social protection policies can be fostered, while respecting national competences. In particular, I am sure that the Social Protection Committee will enable better and more effective exchanges of information and best practices between the institutions in such a way as to ensure better formulation and implementation of social policies.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ I voted along with the majority of MEPs in favour of the decision to establish the Social Protection Committee. The Council Decision aims to establish a Social Protection Committee, with advisory status, to promote cooperation on social protection policies between Member States and with the Commission. The Committee’s membership shall consist of two representatives appointed by each Member State and two representatives of the Commission.

name: Branislav ŠKRIPEK
text: in writing ‒ I voted in favour of the amended Council proposal establishing a Social Protection Committee. This Committee, with an advisory statute, will promote cooperation on social protection policies between EU Member States and the European Commission. It will also promote the exchange of information, experience and good practices in the Member States.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: Writing. – Report on the draft Council Decision establishing the Social Protection Committee and repealing Council Decision 2004/689/EC. I welcome the draft Council decision prolonging and further specifies the mandate of the SPC Social Protection Committee, which operates within the EPSCO Council. The SPC Employment Committee was established in 2004 by Council Decision 2004/689/EC, which defined the institutions, the main tasks and the functioning of the Committee. Over the past 10 years, the committee's tasks have adapted to current developments in the Union and today focus mainly on advising ministers on employment outcomes in the context of the European Semester. It shall cooperate with other competent authorities and committees on social and economic policy matters, such as the Employment Committee, the Economic and Financial Committee and the Economic Policy Committee. As the draft Council decision reflects well the role of the Social Protection Committee in the context of the European Semester, which should monitor in particular the social situation and the development of social protection policies in the Member States and in the Union and promote the exchange of information, experience and good practice between Member States, I voted in favour of the report on the draft decision in the vote.

name: Renato SORU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted today in favour of the report for the re-set up of a social protection committee. This proposal lays the foundations for closer monitoring of the social situation within the Union, as well as the development of social protection policies within the Member States and the European Union. Such a monitoring operation, combined with a greater exchange of information between Member States, will allow a better and deeper knowledge of the levels of social inclusion, health and pensions, thanks also to the open method of coordination. The Committee will also be able to establish contacts with the social partners and non-governmental social organisations in order to obtain as much information as possible and to ensure better supervision of social protection, preventing it from being put into the background even in times of crisis.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. - Given the high unemployment rate, gender inequality, as well as the large difference in standards within member states, work needs to be done to strengthen the social security system that is essential for further development and modernisation of active and dynamic social policy in Europe. The only way to mitigate differences within the EU is through cooperation between Member States covering all forms of social security and mutual exchange of experience.  For this reason, it is necessary to establish a enhanced cooperation mechanism on which a group of senior officials would work to help Member States improve and strengthen their social security systems in line with national priorities. When implementing social policy, Member States are responsible for the organisation and financing of social security.  The main objectives set by the Commission in the context of the overall challenge of modernising social security systems are: to make work cost-effective and income safe, to achieve pension security and the sustainability of pension systems, to promote social inclusion, to ensure high quality and sustainability of health care.

name: Richard SULÍK
text: in writing ‒ I voted against the decision because I do not think it will help the economy or employment or the quality of jobs. Fortunately, the new committee is only supposed to have advisory status and is therefore, in particular, to monitor the situation in the Member States, to prepare various reports and so on. However, it will still contribute to the further senseless growth of the European Union's bureaucracy, precisely from the money of the employees and employers themselves.

name: Neoklis SYLIKIOTIS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 We consider the special circumstances of each Member State to be of enormous importance. This resolution aims to strengthen cooperation under the auspices and within the Commission, with a view to modernising insurance funds and working conditions. This, of course, means further monitoring of the Member States.   In our view, eu policy enforcement in the Member States would be disastrous, especially for countries with small economies such as Cyprus.  In view of the neoliberal direction of EU policies and aware of the devastating consequences of the imposition of neoliberal policies of harsh austerity, we decided to vote against.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 The Social Protection Committee should aim to ensure cost-effective work and secure income, ensure safe and sustainable pension systems, promote social inclusion and ensure sustainable, high-quality healthcare for all.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the decision to establish a Social Protection Committee because I consider it important to modernise social protection systems comprehensively, also in order to ensure high quality and sustainable health care for all. I also agree with the point in the draft which emphasises that, while fully respecting the competences of the Member States, we should also create the possibility of better coordination with regard to employment and social policy and socio-economic policies.
